Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Obedient disciple of the True Guru considers the support of Guru teachings and wisdom as authentic and true. He has no one else in his heart other than One God. He does not recognise god-Shiv or goddess-Shakti as a means of emancipation. He remains a medi

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: He remains unsullied of the influence of maya. Defeat or victory, happiness or sorrow does not disturb or please him. He remains absorbed in supreme spiritual state discarding all thoughts of achievements and failures.

lines.gurmukhi: cqur brn iek brn huie swDsMg; pMc prpMc iqAwig ibsm ibsÍwsI hY [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: By joining true congregation he destroys the differences of high low caste and belongs to One God. Detaching from the love of five elements, he takes to Naam Simran of the wondrous God Lord and holds his faith in Him.

lines.gurmukhi: Kt drsn prY pwr huie spqsr; nv duAwr aulMiG dsmeI audwsI hY [333[

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: A Gursikh stays in the company of true seekers beyond the garbs of the six philosophical schools. He frees himself from the bonds of nine doors of the body and lives blissfully in of the tenth door (Dasam Duar). (333)
